question.text: How many items can be stored in the inventory?

answer.details: 27 stacks can be stored in the main inventory, 9 in the hotbar, 1 off-hand slot and 4 armour slots. Giving a potential maximum of 2372 individual items.

question.text: How many items can be stored in a double chest?

answer.details: 54 stacks of items works out as a total of 3456 individual items. Assuming all items can be stacked up to 64.

question.text: How fast can the player run?
What's the fastest form of travel over long distance?

answer.details: A thrown ender pearl has a chance of traveling up to slightly over 54 blocks, with a flight time of around 3 seconds. This gives a travel speed of 54 / 3 = ~18 blocks per second.

question.text: Which blocks are effected by gravity?

answer.details: TNT blocks won't fall until they are primed.

question.text: How do you drop a stack of items?

answer.details: You can also drop stacks by picking one up in the inventory screen and clicking outside the inventory window. Also exiting the inventory screen once a stack has been picked up will drop it.

question.text: How popular is Minecraft?

answer.text: Minecraft is the second best selling computer game on all platforms.
answer.details: Second only to Tetris and selling 106.86 million copies world wide.

question.text: How do you get Minecraft?

answer.text: Minecraft can be purchased from the Minecraft.net store.
answer.details: Alternatively you can buy download cards from certain stores which you can use to redeem online.

question.text: What age is Minecraft rated for?

answer.details: Although you have to be 13 to purchase an account with Mojang you do not need to be this age to play.

question.text: How much does Minecraft cost?

answer.details: Check Minecraft.net for your local exchange rates.

question.text: How many items can you store in a double chest?
How many items can I store in a double chest?
Which blocks can Endermen pick up?

answer.text: Endermen can only pick up the following blocks; Allium, Azure Bluet, Blue Orchid, Dandelion, Orange Tulip, Red Tulip, Pink Tulip, White Tulip, Oxeye Daisy, Poppy, Cactus, Clay, Coarse Dirt, Dirt, Grass Block, Gravel, Melon (block), Pumpkin, Mycelium, Podzol, Red Mushroom, Brown Mushroom, Red Sand, Sand, TNT and Netherrack.
answer.details: Endermen will drop the block they are carrying when they are killed.

question.text: At what light level can mushrooms grow?

answer.details: Mushrooms will not grow directly underneath sky.

question.text: How can you get the seed of a world?

answer.details: You can also view the seed of a world if you are able to select it in the Select world screen and then press Re-create and then More world options.

question.text: What is a snapshot?

answer.text: An experimental pre-release of the game prior to an official update.
answer.details: Snapshots are a way fo the developers of the game to get early feedback and testing of features prior to them being added to the game.

question.text: How do you complete Minecraft?

answer.details: Although killing the Ender Dragon is the end of the game the player is free to continue playing and even respawning the Ender Dragon for continual fights.

question.text: What should be done first in survival mode?

answer.details: Wood is the basis for all things required in the early stages of the game, so it is recommended to harvest some trees and craft the wood blocks into wooden planks.

question.text: What should be done second in survival mode?

answer.details: If it's your first game, protecting yourself from the dangers of nighttime is a top priority. This involves building a basic shelter, some tools and ideally a bed and some lighting to get through the first night.

question.text: How can health be restored?

answer.text:
The many ways to restore health are:

  • Health naturally regenerates slowly over time whenever the hunger bar is at 18 or above.
  • The regeneration effect.
  • The absorption effect.
  • The instant health potion.
answer.details: Regeneration can be acquired from beacons, potions and golden apples. The unenchanted golden apple provides regeneration at level II which regenerates a maximum of 4 hearts over 5 seconds. The enchanted variety however restores 16 hearts over 20 seconds.
